headline: A Look At S&P Global (SPGI) Valuation After Dividend Hike And Planned Mobility Spin Off
summary: Dividend change and planned spin off come into focus S&P Global (SPGI) recently approved a 1.0% increase in its regular quarterly dividend to $0.97 per share, with the move explicitly tied to the expected spin off of its Mobility division in 2026. The new payout, which equates to an annualized dividend of $3.88 per share, is scheduled for March 11, 2026, to shareholders of record on February 25, 2026. This schedule gives investors clearer visibility on upcoming cash returns. See our latest...

headline: CARFAX: Nearly One Million Vehicles Have Open Child Seat Anchor Safety Recalls
summary: New CARFAX data finds that nearly one million vehicles currently on U.S. roads have open recalls for defective LATCH connectors, potentially putting millions of children at risk.

raw.headline: CARFAX: Nearly One Million Vehicles Have Open Child Seat Anchor Safety Recalls
raw.summary: New CARFAX data finds that nearly one million vehicles currently on U.S. roads have open recalls for defective LATCH connectors, potentially putting millions of children at risk.

headline: Barings Supports Gresham’s Acquisition of S&P Global’s Enterprise Data Management Business
summary: CHARLOTTE, N.C., January 20, 2026--Barings, one of the world’s leading investment managers, announced today that it served as the Agent on senior secured credit facilities to support Gresham’s acquisition of S&P Global’s Enterprise Data Management business. Gresham is backed by STG, a firm with expertise in building and scaling market-leading software, data and analytics companies.

headline: MoneyShow's Best Investment Ideas For 2026: Part 8
summary: MoneyShow presents top investment ideas for 2026 from leading advisors. Part 8 includes Rithm Capital, Sonoco Products, SPDR Portfolio Europe ETF, and Sprott Physical Silver Trust.
